body:
Hi Shri and Andy,

I think you can "spread" the "direct" component when applying a
roughness to the trans material. Then, the scattered light is not
lambertian any more. You can control the scattering "width" by the
roughness.
You can see the difference then if you look directly onto the material
(smaller or larger spot towards sun direction).  Getting different
patches on the wall etc. is quite hard I guess. The reason for this is ,
that as soon as the "direct part" is scattered (when applying
roughness), it is handled by the ambient calculation and it is not part
of the direct calculation any more.

Using a BSDF with a fine resolution is in fact the best way to handle this.

good luck,

Jan
